questionnaires.question:
What is the output of the following program?

#include<iostream>

using namespace std;
main() {
   int i = 13, j = 60;
   i^=j;
   j^=i;
   i^=j;
   cout<<i<<" "<<j;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include<iostream>

using namespace std;
void f() {
   cout<<"Hello"<<endl;
}
main() {
}
answers: Error, as the function is not called.
Error, as the function is defined without its declaration
Error, as the main() function is left empty

}
How can we make an class act as an interface in C++?
answers: By only providing all the functions as virtual functions in the class.
Defining the class following with the keyword virtual
Defining the class following with the keyword interface
Defining the class following with the keyword abstract

questionnaires.question: One of the following is true for an inline function.
answers: It executes faster as it is treated as a macro internally
It executes faster because it priority is more than normal function
It doesn’t executes faster compared to a normal function
None of the above holds true for an inline function
